doc_id: Leslie - 1740 - A new and exact account of Jamaica_page_184.xml
text:
176
LETTER VII.
stice of Peace, if not exceeding 40s. if more,
in any Court of Record.
No Person whatsoever shall kill any Cattle,
Horse, Mare, Mule, or Assinego, under the
Penalty of 15l. to be recovered in any Court
of Record, by the owner or Proprietor of the
said Beast.
All Owners of Neat Cattle shall keep one
white Man at each Pen, and two white Men
at every Pen, whereunto belongs above 200
Head of Cattle, Penalty 10 l. for every white
Man wanting for the Space of three Months,
Half to the Poor of the Parish, Half to the
Informer.
All Owners of Cattle shall pen them once
in three Nights at least, or pay the Damage
double which such Cattle shall do.
Strays shall belong to the Proprietor of the
Ground where taken up, provided he cries the
Stray three Court Days with proper Descriptions,
and turns the same loose in the feeding
Grounds, with a Withe about the Neck for an
Year; and if not claimed in that Time, the
property shall be his. Ear mark'd, or burnt
mark'd Cattle shall belong to the right Owners,
if claim'd any Time after the Expiration
of the Year.
The Clerk of each respective Court of Record
in this Island shall make Entry, and toll
all Sorts of Cattle that shall be sold from one
Per-
